$interpreted: : A few months later
Dracontines: ... The Dragoneye Gem and Sun Capitol have crashed in Atlas?
Izumi: Quite a sight to behold, right? Haha~
Dracontines: Master Izumi, any orders on what to do next?
Izumi: Next...
Izumi: Who's there!?
Hyde: Are you the Dracontines? Finally found you people.
Hyde: As expected, the locations where you people set up altars have a certain logical pattern behind them...
Hyde: No need to be so riled up. I'm here to help you people.
Izumi: Help us? What can you do?
Hyde: Get rid of Theodore and Angelia.
Hyde: With the two descendants of Vendacti gone, Kingdom of the Sun will definitely fall into chaos. When that time arrives,
Hyde: no one will be there to interfere with your plans to revive Sdorica.
Hyde: What do you think of this deal?

Izumi: I don't like you all smiling and happy~
That's supposed to be my character~

Izumi: Nonetheless, I will keep my patience and ask;
how can you prove that you have what it takes to complete your proposal?
Hyde: I have the ability to figure out where your altars are located with nothing more than these crude documents.
Hyde: In addition, due to the effects of my void disease, my right eye can see glimpses of the future. Is that enough proof?
Izumi: Sounds pretty fair. Then what about the price you demand?
Hyde: The documents mentioned that so-called "Immortals" exist within the Dracontines.
Hyde: They are a group of people who can replace their physical bodies in order to allow their minds to live on, thus achieving immortality...
Hyde: I want to know the method they use to replace their bodies!

Izumi: Quite the ambition you got there~ So you want to use the reincarnation method of us immortals~ 
to replace your void disease-infected body?
Izumi: That's an eye that can see the future~ Do you really want to throw it away?

Hyde: A right eye that's gradually losing vision, pain that makes torture pale in comparison...
Compared to these prices I pay, 
I would rather stay far from the future.
Izumi: Interesting~
Dracontines: Master Izumi, is this really okay?
Izumi: Although we've never viewed the Carlos family as a potential threat, someone right here is making a bold claim. Won't hurt to let him try~
Izumi: Besides, it's not like this contradicts with our immediate objectives.
Hyde: Then, I would like you to lead the way.
Izumi: Then this document...

Hyde: It's something left behind by my mentor. I've pretty much deciphered the whole thing. My mentor doesn't have a use for that anymore either.
You can handle it however you desire.
Izumi: From the sound of it, that "mentor" have fallen victim to your shady plans. Is that the future you saw as well?
Hyde: ... I am not obliged to answer any of this...
Izumi: But I really want to know~ How did you feel when that happened? Has the thought of changing the future ever flashed through your mind?
Izumi: Or, alternatively, if you didn't have void disease, you wouldn't have to kill your master. You could've shared a peaceful and quiet life with him...
Izumi: At that moment, have you ever thought of, or hoped to see a future like this?
Hyde: Are all Dracontines as talkative and noisy as you?
Izumi: Oooohhh~ Finally got you mad~ First victory for Izumi~

Model.Text: A few months later
... The Dragoneye Gem and Sun Capitol have crashed in Atlas?
Quite a sight to behold, right? Haha~
Master Izumi, any orders on what to do next?
Next...
Who's there!?
Are you the Dracontines? Finally found you people.
As expected, the locations where you people set up altars have a certain logical pattern behind them...
No need to be so riled up. I'm here to help you people.
Help us? What can you do?
Get rid of Theodore and Angelia.
With the two descendants of Vendacti gone, Kingdom of the Sun will definitely fall into chaos. When that time arrives,
no one will be there to interfere with your plans to revive Sdorica.
What do you think of this deal?

I don't like you all smiling and happy~
That's supposed to be my character~

Nonetheless, I will keep my patience and ask;
how can you prove that you have what it takes to complete your proposal?
I have the ability to figure out where your altars are located with nothing more than these crude documents.
In addition, due to the effects of my void disease, my right eye can see glimpses of the future. Is that enough proof?
Sounds pretty fair. Then what about the price you demand?
The documents mentioned that so-called "Immortals" exist within the Dracontines.
They are a group of people who can replace their physical bodies in order to allow their minds to live on, thus achieving immortality...
I want to know the method they use to replace their bodies!

Quite the ambition you got there~ So you want to use the reincarnation method of us immortals~ 
to replace your void disease-infected body?
That's an eye that can see the future~ Do you really want to throw it away?

A right eye that's gradually losing vision, pain that makes torture pale in comparison...
Compared to these prices I pay, 
I would rather stay far from the future.
Interesting~
Master Izumi, is this really okay?
Although we've never viewed the Carlos family as a potential threat, someone right here is making a bold claim. Won't hurt to let him try~
Besides, it's not like this contradicts with our immediate objectives.
Then, I would like you to lead the way.
Then this document...

It's something left behind by my mentor. I've pretty much deciphered the whole thing. My mentor doesn't have a use for that anymore either.
You can handle it however you desire.
From the sound of it, that "mentor" have fallen victim to your shady plans. Is that the future you saw as well?
... I am not obliged to answer any of this...
But I really want to know~ How did you feel when that happened? Has the thought of changing the future ever flashed through your mind?
Or, alternatively, if you didn't have void disease, you wouldn't have to kill your master. You could've shared a peaceful and quiet life with him...
At that moment, have you ever thought of, or hoped to see a future like this?
Are all Dracontines as talkative and noisy as you?
Oooohhh~ Finally got you mad~ First victory for Izumi~
